description: Comprehensive crop database for Maharashtra with agroclimatic zones and soil requirements

crops.name: Rice
best_soil_types: Deep alluvial soil with good water retention
crops.cultivation_tips: Requires standing water during growing season

crops.name: Jowar (Sorghum)
best_soil_types: Medium to deep black cotton soil
Red lateritic soil with good drainage
crops.cultivation_tips: Drought tolerant crop suitable for rainfed conditions

crops.name: Soybean
best_soil_types: Deep black cotton soil with good organic matter
Medium textured soil with adequate calcium
crops.cultivation_tips: Nitrogen fixing legume, benefits from rhizobium inoculation

crops.name: Cotton
best_soil_types: Deep black cotton soil with good water holding capacity
Medium to heavy textured soil with pH 6.0-8.0
crops.cultivation_tips: Requires long frost-free period and adequate moisture

crops.name: Wheat
best_soil_types: Well-drained loamy soil with good fertility
Deep clay loam with adequate nitrogen
crops.cultivation_tips: Requires cool weather during grain filling stage

crops.name: Sugarcane
best_soil_types: Deep alluvial soil with high organic matter
Fertile soil with pH 6.0-7.5 and good water retention
crops.cultivation_tips: Requires abundant water and long growing season

crops.name: Onion
best_soil_types: Well-drained sandy loam with good organic matter
Medium textured soil with adequate phosphorus
crops.cultivation_tips: Requires well-drained soil to prevent bulb rot

Deep fertile soil with good water retention
crops.cultivation_tips: Sensitive to waterlogging and extreme temperatures
